0.name: Life
0.text:
I am nearing my day of birth yet again. It will be the twenty first.
While to most it would seem a day of happiness.
I look at it the opposite.
This year I have graduated for a course I was happy to start.
But time has shown that it might not be within my interest in this form.
Therefor I feel a part of life was wasted. I have yet to understand what I truly want to do with the years that remain.
I feel like a rock in a river. With life flowing around me. Unmoved. Waiting for change. Change that might never come if I stay this way.

1.name: Friends
1.text:
During my time in this realm of mortality I have made friends of many. Though very few have stuck with me past my time of being around them.
Grateful I am to those who remain. Those whom I can consider close.
True friends.
However I fear that the friends I have made in the past year become one with those who no longer seek contact with me. The thought haunts me daily. I fear that I might end up alone once more.
I fear the void we call loneliness.
Often I sit down, just me and my thoughts. No one to join my pondering. To fill up the void.

2.name: Love
2.text:
It was a while ago when I first felt it. I felt it for a friends. But for the three years I was around. I was too scared to say something. And now we talk no longer.
I often wonder what life would be had I been more courageous.
But now I have felt it once more.
Someone else. Another friend.
But it is different this time. While I send it from my side. I know I will never receive it.
While to some it is a blessing. To me it is a curse. I feel the weight on my chest whenever I mention it.
I feel like I am driving them away whenever I send it.
I am lost.
And I do not know the way.

3.name: Fate
3.text:
My existence, my being, my mortality are comming thougts which cycle through my head more often than not.
My future, my past, my heart's desires. And the choices made which brought me here. Could I have done something different I wonder. Could I have been happy.

I offered to have my heart cut out. In the ceremony of this rotation.
I hope to be placed among the others. I hope to be happy. I hope to be unalone.
I hope for my soul to be at peace within it. And may I be found.
I ask, please, take care of me.
